body: Minister Purbaya says stronger public-private coordination and investment reforms could lift growth to 6% this year.

title: Rupiah Gains as Trade Optimism Offsets Global Tensions
body: Indonesia’s rupiah posted a modest gain as markets reacted to positive trade news amid ongoing global uncertainty.

title: IDX Confirms Jeffrey Hendrik as Interim President Director
body: Jeffrey Hendrik steps in as acting IDX chief after Iman Rachman resigned amid market turmoil and a temporary trading halt.

title: Sarawak Open to Doing Business with Indonesia’s New Capital
body: Sarawak Premier Abang Johari says that there is an opportunity for businesspeople from both sides to team up in Nusantara.

title: JCI Reclaims Positive Territory After MSCI Talks Soothe Market Nerves
body: JCI rebounded sharply on Tuesday, jumping 2.52% after MSCI talks eased market jitters.

title: Merdeka Copper Gold Targets Up to 205,000 Ounces in 2026 Growth Push
body: Merdeka Copper Gold targets up to 205,000 ounces of gold in 2026, driven by first output from Pani and steady production at Tujuh Bukit.

title: ‘Lawmakers’ Review First’: Indonesia on What Comes Next After US Deal Signing
body: Other trade pacts usually have to go through Indonesian lawmakers before the terms can fully enter into force.

title: Indonesia Targets Strong Start to 2026 With $760 Million Stimulus Package
body: Rp 12.8 trillion stimulus package featuring transport discounts and social aid is set to bolster Indonesia’s economy in early 2026.

title: Indonesian Coal Export Sink 19.70% with India, China as Top Buyers
body: India imported $4.98 billion worth of Indonesian coal throughout 2025, BPS says.

title: Indonesia’s Exports Hold Strong, but Geopolitical Tensions Threaten 2026 Growth
body: Indonesia’s trade surplus extended in December as economists flagged growing protectionist risks and cost pressures facing exports.

title: From Frying Pans to Fuel Tanks: Indonesia Limits Palm Oil Exports for Energy
body: Indonesia prioritizes domestic palm oil for biofuel, curbing exports to boost energy self-sufficiency and create high-value products.

title: Antam Gold Slides Rp 183,000 Amid Global Market Pressure
body: Antam gold slid Rp 183,000 on Tuesday after Monday’s surge, while global prices eased and JPMorgan maintained a bullish outlook.

title: JCI Edges Lower as Market Waits on OJK Leadership, MSCI Reforms
body: JCI slipped 0.43% at the open as investors stayed cautious amid uncertainty over OJK leadership and a lengthy MSCI reform process.

title: Indonesia–US Trade Tariff Talks Completed, Await Leaders’ Meeting, Airlangga Says
body: Indonesia says tariff talks with the US are complete, with only legal drafting and a Prabowo–Trump meeting left to seal the deal.

title: Indonesia Wants to Be Top Aviation Fuel Supplier, Curbs Used Cooking Oil Export
body: Last August, Pertamina tried using UCO-based sustainable aviation fuel for its subsidiary Pelita Air's commercial flight.

title: Jakarta’s Answer to MSCI’s Market Doubts
body: Indonesia’s regulator detailed plans to raise free float levels and expand ownership disclosure in response to MSCI’s market concerns.

title: Prabowo, Luhut Downplay JCI Selloff as Indonesia Pushes Market Reforms
body: Prabowo and Luhut sought to reassure investors after the JCI slump, casting the volatility as a catalyst for market reform.

title: Danantara Steps In as OJK, IDX Hold Talks With MSCI
body: Indonesian authorities met MSCI after a sharp market selloff, as state investor Danantara began buying stocks it sees as undervalued.

title: Heavy Selling Hammers JCI Nearly 5% as MSCI Reform Talks Near
body: Jakarta stocks sold off sharply, with the JCI sliding nearly 5% as investors stayed cautious ahead of MSCI-linked reform talks.

title: Indonesia’s Export of ‘Highly Coveted’ Palm Oil Up 21.83%
body: Indonesia’s annual export of crude palm oil (CPO) and derivatives totaled $24.42 billion last year, BPS reported.
